content: It would be really nice to create an advent of code stream so that we could discuss different day's solutions in different threads.
The community discord has an AoC 2021 channel, which you might be interested in: https://discord.gg/rust-lang-community

Thanks for sharing the link to the discord. We have a Julia zulip advent of code stream, and it's better than slack and discord (imo) because 1) we can have discussions for each day, and 2) it allows much more richer discussion options (LaTeX for example). It's also easier to find solutions from last year's advent of code discussion on the Julia zulip stream. I've attached a few of screenshots as an example:

Screen-Shot-2021-12-07-at-9.24.28-AM.png

Screen-Shot-2021-12-07-at-9.22.54-AM.png

Screen-Shot-2021-12-07-at-9.27.29-AM.png

In my view, the Rust Zulip instance is more focused on people working on Rust itself, not as much the users of Rust. It's not that users are unwelcome here, it's just not optimized for them. Creating things for AoC would be a type of that optimization, which is why I don't think it's appropriate.
Thanks for the answer! That makes sense :)
